review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2025
review-text: Phone came in great at first, was loving it to death it's really cool phone. Worked flawlessly. It was my first galaxy, and I plan on getting a normal galaxy after this. The hinge is shockingly fragile, and I don't know if this is because it is a design flaw of the phone itself or because it's a refurb. A very short fall on that while the phone is closed and it's pretty much done for. It completely dislocated on one side and it would not open up all the way, looked decently repairable until the screen started dying. It eventually pinched the flexible screen and killed pixels. As far as I know there's no cases that protect the hinge. I was lucky to be within the 90 day return window or else I'd be forking over a lot of money in order to repair it :( I got a lot of compliments on it and I'm really sad to say goodbye to such a dope phone. But maybe later models will be less prone to damage.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2025
review-text: I bought different renewed products from Amazon but this time didn't end up very well. As soon as I turned it on it was showing green lines; which in a foldable phone is a really bad sign. Things got worst and worst as I set up the phone, to the point where the screen would go off and on as I was changing the folding position. At times the whole screen would get of a shade of green, which I never seen before to be honest. I could not even use it for few hours that these problems started to show up, so I just packed it back and returned it. Maybe it was a defective unit, maybe it was a coincidence but this is the second foldable from Samsung that ended up having problems, and I am not going to take the risk, as I already wasted 1K on a Z-Fold 4 last year. Maybe it is better to wait few more years for a foldable phone

span: I love it! But not sure if it came with a screen protector
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
review-text: So I ordered another EXCELLENT CONDITION flip4 from Bayshine, the 256GB version this time, hoping it'd be flawless like the 128GB one I got back in December (ended up giving it to my mother) but the one I got today, after a week, was in like "good enough condition" HUH? I was really hoping Bayshine would be consistent in it's excellent condition lines but I guess not because this one came with tiny but MANY scratches on the cover screen and VERY noticeable scratch/dent on the hinge and a slight popping/scratchy sound on the right side of the hinge where the sratches are so I will be returning and trying ElGeo fingers crossed -PREVIOUS REVIEW 128GB EXCELLENT CONDITION- (5/5 stars) First of all, shipping was SO QUICK took like 3 days to get to me and I've only had it for 3 days and I really really like it! Works great and came in truly excellent condition, but I'm not sure if it had a screen protector or not, no where in the description did it say it comes with one so I have place one on and was doing a bit of a closing and opening test and it all seems fine, gonna leave it open for a while just incase ðŸ˜…

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2025
review-text: I loved the phone but I guess I'm either too rough or the phones come defective because it started giving screen issues in the third week not even a day later the screen went out. I LOVED THE PHONE but the foldable screen needs work. I'm 200~ dollars out and once again phoneless :(

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2024
review-text: Seller described phone as excellent condition. I've purchased phones from Amazon renewed plenty of times. This one disappointment me because it had a piece of the where it folds lifting on the edge. If it already had that at the fold it would be only gotten worse so I sent it back order same phone different seller. Paid a little more for it. But it came perfect condition. I now have the phone just not this specific one. Great sound, battery life lasts me all day and I'm primarily using it at work 8 hrs straight music. Light weight. Durable dopped a few times works as normal. No cosmetic damage. Overall I wasn't happy with seller but the actual phone,  samsung galaxy z flip 4 is awesome and different. Brings flip phones to another level.

span: They might be cool, but they don't hold up.Think twice before buying this
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2025
review-text: This phone breaks so easy.It was broke within two months. Avoid flip phones, they are not built to last

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2025
review-text: Phone arrived damaged, i couldn't close it because it would turn off. I have the phone for 7 months now and phone won't turn on at all now.
a-color-secondary: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2025
a-size-base: Phone arrived damaged, i couldn't close it because it would turn off. I have the phone for 7 months now and phone won't turn on at all now.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2024
review-text: I was so excited about my phone, i really do love it ... But the battery life is absolutely horrible!! Takes forever to charge, even with a fast charger and will start alerting me when it starts to overheat, which is often. I will start my day at 830am with 100% charge, by noon it is at 10-20%. I don't even understand how when I'm at work and not using it. I always close out my apps, clear cashes, optimize, lower my brightness etc ... doesn't help. I'm so confused. I had a note 9 for 5 years that has better battery life. That phone would go 2 days with extended use without needing a charge. I reached out to seller a few weeks ago, haven't heard back but will reach out again. It's been 2 months at this point, not sure if anything can be done.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2025
review-text: Phone is good but sometimes it auto shuts down when closing the lid especially when using a specific chargers. i don't know what's wrong with these kind of flip phones, not sure if its the build quality or the fact that its used is causing this issue. I wish i could return this as it starts to cause problems after 1 year of usage. Stay away from flip phones, usability is not as facny as it looks. Durability is the problem Screensize is solid for such a thing phone, sound quality is meh and features are topnotch anyways since its samsung

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2024
review-text: I've only had my flip z 4 phone for 2.5 months and it's already of NO USE to me!  I was told by the Samsung office that the warranty on the phone expired before I purchased it and if I needed it fixed I would have to pay out of pocket to get the screen repaired.  I attached a photo of the phone which has a bleed that is growing wider every day.  The bleed started at the crease of the fold and got bigger and bigger.  BTW, I did not drop it!  It did not get wet! I only opened and closed as I used it.  This was a bad purchase!
